  • java.lang.Object

    • Method Detail

      • setDeadZone

        public void setDeadZone(float value)
        Sets the dead zone for the analog sticks. The dead zone is a value that prevents the GamepadListener.onAnalogStickPush(GamepadEvent) method from being called if the intensity with which the analog stick is pushed is not higher.
        Parameters:
        value - a value between 0.0F and 0.9999998807907104fF (using 1.0F would disable the analog sticks)
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • addGamepadListener

        public void addGamepadListener(GamepadListener listener)
        Adds a GamepadListener.
        Parameters:
        listener - the GamepadListener
        Since:
        1.0.0

        Since:

        Parameters:

        Since:

        Returns:

        Since:

      • rumble

        public void rumble(float intensity)
        Rumbles the gamepad with the given intensity. Does nothing if canRumble() returns false.
        Parameters:
        intensity - the intensity with wich the gamepad should rumble
        (0.0F = 0%, 1.0F = 100%)
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • canRumble

        public boolean canRumble()
        Returns:
        true if this gamepad has a rumble function, else false
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • getButtonCount

        public int getButtonCount()
        Returns:
        the amount of buttons on the gamepad (extra buttons are not counted)
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • isXDown

        public boolean isXDown()
        Returns:
        true if the X/4 button is currently down, else false
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • isYDown

        public boolean isYDown()
        Returns:
        true if the Y/1 button is currently down, else false
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • isADown

        public boolean isADown()
        Returns:
        true if the A/3 button is currently down, else false
        Since:
        1.0.0

        public boolean isBDown()
        Returns:
        true if the X/2 button is currently down, else false
        Since:

      • setControlCursorWithAnalogStick

        public void setControlCursorWithAnalogStick(boolean flag)
        Enables/Disables the ability to control the mouse cursor with an analog stick.
        Parameters:
        flag - true = enable, false = disable
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • setAnalogStickControllingCursor

        public void setAnalogStickControllingCursor(int analogStick)
        Sets which analog stick should control the mouse cursor.
        Parameters:
        analogStick - can be either GamepadEvent.ANALOG_STICK_LEFT or GamepadEvent.ANALOG_STICK_RIGHT
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • isCursorControlledByAnalogStick

        public boolean isCursorControlledByAnalogStick()
        Returns:
        true if an analog stick is controlling the mouse cursor, else false
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • getCursorSensity

        public float getCursorSensity()
        Returns:
        the sensity with which the cursor is moved
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • getAnalogStickControllingCursor

        public int getAnalogStickControllingCursor()
        Returns:
        the analog stick controlling the mouse cursor (can be either GamepadEvent.ANALOG_STICK_LEFT or GamepadEvent.ANALOG_STICK_RIGHT)
        Since:
        1.0.0
